Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Thoracofemoral Bypass as Primary Treatment for Juxtarenal Aortoiliac Occlusive Disease

Participants.evidence: conducted at S.M.S. Medical College and Group of Hospitals, Jaipur, on 90 patients with severe aortoiliac occlusive disease

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved thoracobifemoral bypass using BARD IMPRA expanded polytetrafluoroethylene vascular grafts.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates its efficacy as a primary treatment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 30-day graft patency.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: No randomisation or blinding was employed.

Blinding.evidence: No randomisation or blinding was employed.

Harms.evidence: Major morbidities included graft occlusion in one patient, managed by embolectomy, and ascites in another, addressed conservatively.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was not registered as a trial
